paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant c.3847_3848delGT, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: Breast cancer of various biological types

individual_records.phenotype_details: Stage III right breast ductal carcinoma, triple negative
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In February 2017, Patient 1 at age 62 was diagnosed with stage III right breast ductal carcinoma.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Left breast ductal cancer, stage III, ER and PR-negative
individual_records.evidence_sentence: In 2001, the younger sister of the proband (Patient 2) was initially diagnosed with left breast ductal cancer of stage III at age 32.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Moderately differentiated invasive ductal right breast carcinoma, stage II, ER and PR positive
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A diagnosis of moderately differentiated (G2) invasive ductal right breast carcinoma of stage II was registered in 2007.

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 c.3847_3848delGT mutation causes a frameshift and generates a mutant protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family.
variants.population_frequency: The frequency of this mutation is extremely rare in the Baltic region.
variants.additional_notes: All identified cases were diagnosed with advanced stage breast cancer at a young age.
key_quotes: In conclusion, the strong influence of BRCA2 mutation on the onset of BC of various biological types reveals the complexity of genetic counselling in families with BC history.
At least three BRCA2 c.3847_3848delGT mutation-positive BC cases were identified, suggesting a high penetrance of the mutation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
